result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald Sean Nimmo was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Not to have contact with Brady Hughes-Lepinski or Joshua Kuehl unless/until probation removes the restriction.
Not to have contact with Wal-Mart-St Croix Falls, WI.

Must follow rules of supervision.
Must provide a DNA sample.  Under Wisconsin Statute 165.76, you are required to provide a biological specimen to the Wisconsin Department of Justice for deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) testing.  If you fail to provide a DNA sample, you may be held in contempt and subject to sanctions or charged with a new crime.

$200.00 DNA surcharge to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.

$265.60 fine/costs to be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.

$382.10 to Wal-mart, joint & several with Brady Hughes-Lepinski & Joshua J Kuehl. 10% surcharge to the DA office. To be paid to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or set up payment plan. Failure to pay may result in a tax intercept, license suspension, warrant and/or civil judgment subject to collection efforts.

records.addlTxt:
9:04 AM Defendant Ronald Sean Nimmo in court, in custody.  Attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore in court for Ronald Sean Nimmo.  Attorney Benjamin James Webster in court for State of Wisconsin. CW-clerk. 
Count 1-AMENDED-misd retail theft PTAC 943.50(1m)(b)&(4)(a)-guilty plea. CT accepts plea, adj guilty & judgment entered. 
Count 3-misd retail theft-guilty plea. CT accepts plea, adj guilty & judgment entered. 
All other counts DRI

SENTENCE: 
Count 1-w/h, probation 12 mo. 91 days credit. Not to have contact with Brady Hughes-Lepinski or Joshua Kuehl unless/until probation removes restriction. Not to have contact with Wal-Mart-SCF. Must follow rules of supervision. DNA sample, $200 surcharge, $265.60 fine. Restitution to Wal-Mart-$382.10 J&S with co-def's Brady Hughes-Lepinski or Joshua J Kuehl. 10% surcharge to the DA office. 5% surcharge to COCC. 60 dtp or set pp, ftp-judgment. Must report to probation today.

Count 3-w/h, probation 12 mo. 91 days credit. Not to have contact with Brady Hughes-Lepinski or Joshua Kuehl unless/until probation removes restriction. Not to have contact with Wal-Mart-SCF. Must follow rules of supervision. DNA sample, $200 surcharge, $265.60 fine. 60 dtp or set pp, ftp-judgment. Must report to probation today.

PCR. 9:25 am adj.
NOH - Plea Hearing 10/25/2022 " Return to sender, not deliverable as addressed, unable to forward"
Plea hearing on October 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.

1:36 PM Defendant Ronald Sean Nimmo in court, in custody.  Attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore in court for Ronald Sean Nimmo.  Attorney Benjamin James Webster in court for State of Wisconsin. CH - Clerk State calls Officer Craig Vollendorf - S&T. CT. identification made. CT. venue established, PC found, DE bound over. State to file information at a later time. Atty Larimore asks court address bond and requests signature bond. State objects. CT. motion for bond mod is denied. DE counsel authorized by video. 1:52 pm adj.
Arraignment scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 03:45 pm.
No Contact with Walmart in St. Croix Falls, WI.

1:22 PM Prosecuting attorney David Stilin in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ronald Sean Nimmo appeared by video from Polk County Jail. Atty Donna Burger appears by video means. CH- Clerk Atty Burger is unsure about appointment of counsel. Ct. quashes warrant. State requests cash bond. Atty Burger requests to reinstate signature bond. Ct. sets bond. 1:28 pm adj.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on August 30, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court official changed due to clerical error.
10:03 AM. JL-Clerk. Attorney Benjamin James Webster in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Ronald Sean Nimmo not court. State req warrant, geo to WI and MN. CT authorizes warrant. 10:05 am adj.
Not to have contact with: Wal-Mart, St Croix Falls.

1:41 PM Defendant Ronald Sean Nimmo appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Benjamin James Webster in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Derek W Sanders appeared by video for Ronald Sean Nimmo. CW-clerk. Qualifies, reading waived.  Will be conflict for SPD office.  CT sets bond. Bond cont. 1:43 pm adj.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 10:00 am.
